text: If a class is derived from a base class that had been assigned to elsewhere in the code, `_is_metaclass` will see an `AssignAttr` or an `AssignName` as an inferred `baseobj`. These don't have `qname()`, so we use the first assigned value as the `baseobj` instead.
title: Allow pylint/astroid to correctly interpret a class whose baseclass has been assigned to
clean_text: If class deriv base class assign elsewher code see infer these dont use first assign valu instead

text: If I remember correctly, there was a conversation about this change with @ceridwen on IRC. The result of the conversation was that the original AST was malformed, since it's not possible to have an assign statement as a base class of the node (as this patch might suggest). I'm closing this one.

text:
Allow pylint/astroid to correctly interpret a class whose baseclass has been assigned to

If a class is derived from a base class that had been assigned to elsewhere in
the code, _is_metaclass will see an AssignAttr or an AssignName as an
inferred baseobj. These don't have qname(), so we use the first assigned
value as the baseobj instead.
